denoising

Class NonLocalMeans

  • java.lang.Object
    • denoising.NonLocalMeans

  • public class NonLocalMeans
extends java.lang.Object
    Static library class holding variations of implementations of the Non-Local Means denoising algorithm. Includes three implementations: the classical one, using a neighbourhood search radius, and two stochastic ones (which search for images patches by uniform random or gaussian random, centered on the target pixel, distributions over the image).

    See:
    Buades 2005, A review of image denoising algorithms, with a new one
    Buades, Coll, Morel; A non-local alg for image denoising

    By default, it computes the distance metrics on a Gaussian smoothed imaged patch (sigma=1, radius = 3).
    Author:
    Tristan

      • nonLocalMeansDenoise

        public static ImageTTAA nonLocalMeansDenoise(ImageTTAA img,
                                             double filteringStrength,
                                             int neighbourhoodRadius,
                                             int researchRadius,
                                             DiscreteKernel dk)
                                      throws InvalidRequestException
        Performs classic Non-local means denoising.
        Parameters:
        img - input image
        filteringStrength - h, used in the filter strength formula in the h2 term
        neighbourhoodRadius - the size of the patch filter
        researchRadius - the area around the target in which to check the neighbourhood patch values
        dk - the smoothing kernel used on the image before the distance metric is computed
        Returns:
        the filtered image
        Throws:
        InvalidRequestException

      • nonLocalMeansDenoise

        public static ImageTTAA nonLocalMeansDenoise(ImageTTAA img,
                                             int neighbourhoodRadius,
                                             int researchRadius)
                                      throws InvalidRequestException
        Performs classic Non-local means filter denoising with default values. For h, we use beta * sigma, where sigma is the noise standard deviation estimated from the difference in discrete Laplacians (see: Efficient and Robust Nonlocal Means Denoising of MR Data Based on Salient Features Matching, Tristan-Vega et al, 2011). The default distance smoothing kernel is a light Gaussian blur (sigma=1,radius=3).
        Parameters:
        img - input image
        neighbourhoodRadius - the size of the patch filter
        researchRadius - the area around the target in which to check the neighbourhood patch values
        Returns:
        the filtered image
        Throws:
        InvalidRequestException

                                                              int numSamples)
                                                       throws InvalidRequestException
        Performs non-local means, except that instead of specifying a research radius, patches are taken from a uniformly random distribution around the image.
        Parameters:
        img -
        neighbourhoodRadius -
        numSamples - number of random samples to use

      • gaussianStochasticNonLocalMeansDenoise

        public static ImageTTAA gaussianStochasticNonLocalMeansDenoise(ImageTTAA img,
                                                               int neighbourhoodRadius,
                                                               int numSamples,
                                                               double stdDev)
                                                        throws InvalidRequestException
        Performs non-local means, but rather than researching a fixed radius around the target, it randomly samples over the image according to a 2d Gaussian distribution centered on the target pixel. Uses default filtering strength and metric smoothing kernel.
        Parameters:
        img -
        neighbourhoodRadius -
        numSamples - number of random samples to use
        stdDev - sigma of 2d search sample gaussian
        Returns:
        Throws:
        InvalidRequestException
